survey_responses.What do you think your life might be lik: Life in 30 years would be like most of the human made jobs will be replaced by robots and artificial intelligence. Population density in mainland would have increased due to coastal areas submergence. We would have to wear oxygen/normal masks to prevent ourselves from polluted air. The youth population will decrease and dependent population will get increased due to less TFR and increased life expectancy. The era of ruralisation will have been started as opposed to urbanisation .
survey_responses.What is another dangerous outcome you ca: Complete take over of jobs such as bpo, customer interaction via chats etc., will lead to severe unemployment crises. As far as ethical part is concerned, AI is so dangerous that it can create bias among people, suggest irrelevant/wrong solutions to problems such as wrong prescription etc., People would loss their creative side since AI is taking over content and art creation.
survey_responses.What is another positive outcome you can: Modernised agriculture, quick summarisation of important articles, fetching details from multiple pages in short period of time ,optimised work results without much efforts
survey_responses.What are the first decisions in your lif: Plan or schedule my day to day activities
survey_responses.Describe a concrete scenario where you w: Making decisions on my crucial life matters such as education, health practices etc.,
survey_responses.Explain what makes one of these scenario: Less government intervention with proper regulation is better than monopoly especially on AI. If all datas are available in one hand it is more dangerous that we think because they can do anything with that data
Though AI can be better companion it can never replace human emotions and there is a possibility of manipulation than emotional support
survey_responses.What is one ethical or moral principle,: Accountability. If something goes wrong there is no one to be held accountable in technological world
survey_responses.What do you consider your culture? What: Diversity in my culture is the favourite thing. At any given moment there will be any kind of festival will be happening irrespective of the religion.
survey_responses.What is one unique perspective that your: Respecting others, feeding others without any expectations. Valuing others rituals and traditions. And the never ending festivals
survey_responses.What kinds of cultural things would you: That use of my language as such is diminishing when using technology.
survey_responses.What is the biggest problem in your life: Working consistently to achieve my goals. If someone held me accountable I can become better
survey_responses.What is something unique, that other peo: Increased moral values of people. It can be solved many problems in the world
survey_responses.What are you most scared will be true in: Machines and technology taking over nature and humans
survey_responses.If you could make world leaders understa: Rather focusing on filling own pockets care about the people who trusted and voted for you
survey_responses.Lastly, is there anything you felt you c: Being ethical would solve 90% of problems in the world. So try to be ethical to yourself
